  1. Introduction

    CSS: Cascading Style Sheets

  2. Concepts

    CSS code

    1. External style sheet <link rel="stylesheet" type = "text/css" href = "file.css">
    2. Internal style sheet <style> ... </style>
    3. Inline style <h1 style = "color:blue;margin-left:30px;">Header</h1>

    Define a style

    selector {property:value; property:value}

    Selector

    For more, please reference W3C

    SelectorExampleExample description
    [element].class.introclass = "intro"
    #id#firstnameid = "firstname"
    **selects all elements
    elementpselect all p
    element, elementdiv, pselect all div AND p
    element elementdiv pselects all p inside div
    element > elementdiv > pselects all p whose immediate parent is a div
    element + elementdiv + pselect all p that are immediate after a div
    element ~ elementdiv ~ pselect all p that are after a div

    Box model

    Display property

    1. display:inline;
    2. display:block;
    3. hidden it will not occupy space display:none;
    4. visibility:hidden will still take space.

    position

    static, relative, fixed, absolute

    1. static is the default setting. Outlay according to the normal flow
    2. relative is to relative itself normal static position. We can use left, right to set.
    3. fixed even when the broswer is scrolled.
    4. position accroding to its nearest positioned ancestor. (positioned means its position can be anything except relative). If a element does not have a positioned element, it will use body.

    Overlapping

    Using z-index:-1. Big number in front.

    Overflow

    Target, a block element with a specified height. When the content size is greater the container's height.

    1. visible, render out the container
    2. hidden, clip
    3. scroll, add a scroll

  3. Details

    Color

    1. "color: red"
    2. "color: #ff0000"
    3. "color: rgb(255, 0, 0)"
